May there be an ocean of bodies equal to the dust motes in the ocean of worlds,

At that time, all the dragon kings.
Having made such dedications,
he circumambulated the Buddha three times, bowed his head to the Buddha's feet,
and by the Buddha's majestic spiritual power, he returned to his original seat.
At that time, there was a dragon king in the assembly,
named Boundless Adornment Ocean Cloud Majestic Virtue Wheel Canopy,
who was the most distinguished and great among the dragon kings in the trichiliocosm,
and had attained irreversibility.
By the power of his original vows, he had taken on the body of a dragon,
in order to make offerings, pay respects, bow to the TathÄgata, and listen to and accept the true Dharma.
He had come to this JambudvÄ«pa.
At that time, the dragon king rose from his seat,
adjusted his robes, bared his right shoulder,
placed his right knee on the ground, joined his palms towards the Buddha,
and said,
World-Honored One, I now have doubts.
I wish to ask the TathÄgata, the Worthy of Offerings, the Perfectly Enlightened One.
If the Buddha allows me, I will dare to ask.
Having said this,
at that time the World-Honored One,
He said to the Dragon King of Boundless Adorned Ocean Clouds, Majestic Virtuous Wheel Canopy:
Dragon King, if you have any doubts, you may ask as you please.
I will explain it to you, causing you to rejoice.
Having said this,
at that time the Dragon King of Boundless Adorned Ocean Clouds, Majestic Virtuous Wheel Canopy,
then addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One, how can it cause the Dragon Kings to extinguish all suffering and experience peace and happiness?
Having experienced peace and happiness,
in this JambudvÄ«pa, timely rain will fall.ğŸ”½All trees, forests,
medicinal herbs, and seedlings will produce flavors and essences.
Causing all people in JambudvÄ«pa to experience happiness.
Having said this,
at that time the World-Honored One said to the Dragon King of Boundless Adorned Ocean Clouds, Majestic Virtuous Wheel Canopy:
Excellent, excellent!
You now benefit those sentient beings,
and are able to ask the TathÄgata about such matters.
Dragon King, you should now
Listen carefully, listen carefully, and contemplate it well.
I will explain it to you in detail.
Dragon King, there is one Dharma.
If you are able to practice it completely,
It will enable all dragons to eliminate all suffering and attain complete peace and happiness.
What is this one Dharma?
It is practicing great compassion.
Dragon King, if there are any gods or humans who practice great compassion,
Fire cannot burn them, water cannot drown them.
Poison cannot harm them, blades cannot injure them.
Enemies from other lands cannot invade and plunder them.
Whether asleep or awake, they all attain peace and security.
Practicing the power of great compassion, they possess great majestic virtue.
The gods and others in the world cannot disturb them.
Their appearance is upright and dignified, loved and respected by the masses.
Wherever they go, everything is unobstructed.
All suffering is eliminated and their minds attain joy.
All pleasures are complete due to the power of great compassion.
After their lives end, they will be reborn in the Brahma Heaven. O Dragon King, if any heavenly beings practice great kindness,
They will obtain such immeasurable benefits.
Therefore, Dragon King, you should always practice the great kindness with your body, speech, and mind.
Furthermore, Dragon King, there is a dhÄraá¹‡Ä«
Called Bestowing All Bliss.
You should always read, recite, and uphold it.
It can eliminate all the suffering and distress of the dragons and bring them peace and joy.
It will cause rain to fall in the JambudvÄ«pa continent at the right time.
It can make all the trees, forests,
Medicinal herbs, and seedlings produce nourishing flavors.
Dragon King, what is the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« that bestows all bliss?
I will now tell you.

This is the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« that bestows all peace and bliss.
It is upheld by all buddhas. You should all receive and uphold it, read and recite it.
Accomplishing auspicious matters, one enters the Dharma gate and attains peaceful and blissful joy.
Furthermore, NÄga King, there is the majestic and dignified merit and virtue of the wisdom of the cloud-born water treasury that transforms into golden light.
In a single hair pore of Vairocana.
The names of the TathÄgatas who emerge from the same nature.
You should also remember and uphold the names of those TathÄgatas.
They are able to eliminate all the types of nÄgas.
The retinues and assemblies of all the nÄga kings.
And the suffering and distress of those born in the nÄga palaces.
And bestow peace and happiness upon them.

By the power of all Buddhas,
By the true power of Buddhas of the three times, by the compassionate mind, Svaha.
At that time, the World-Honored One, having spoken this mantra, said to the dragon kings,
If there is drought and one wishes to request rain,
One should be in an open place on pure earth,
Removing sand, pebbles, and thorny grass.
An area of twelve steps is taken as the ritual arena.
In the arena, a platform is built, square and ten steps wide, one foot high.
Using fresh cow dung, smear it all around.
In the center of the altar, set up a high seat.
On the seat, spread new green mats and hang a new green curtain.
Three cubits outside the east of the high seat,
use cow dung juice to draw a dragon king with one body and three heads.
On the left and right of the dragon king, draw various dragons surrounding it.
Five cubits outside the south of the high seat,
draw a dragon king with one body and five heads.
Also draw dragons surrounding it on the left and right.
Seven cubits outside the west of the high seat,
draw a dragon king with one body and seven heads.
Also draw dragons surrounding it on the left and right.
Nine cubits outside the north of the high seat,
draw a dragon king with one body and nine heads.
Also draw dragons surrounding it on the left and right.
In the four corners of the altar, place four flower vases.
Each can hold three liters.
Mix water with gold essence or blue malachite, etc., to make it clear.
Fill the vases completely.
Insert various grasses, trees, and flower stamens into the vases.
At the four gates of the ritual arena, set up a large incense burner.
Burn various kinds of incense, such as frankincense, aloeswood, benzoin, sandalwood, and cassia.
Hang seven blue banners on each of the four sides.
A total of twenty-seven banners.
The banners are one zhang long.
Light sesame oil lamps, also as many as the banners.
Various fruits, sesame, curd, and rice gruel.
Arrange on the four sides.
In front of the nÄga kings, scatter flowers and burn incense without interruption. The fruits, food, and water in the vases.
Must be fresh every day, and the old ones cannot be used.
Always in the early morning, when the sun first rises, set up the offerings.
The person who reads the sÅ«tra, whether a bhiká¹£u or bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä«.
Must have pure precepts and conduct.
If they are laypeople, they should uphold the eight precepts every day.
Bathe three times a day with fragrant hot water.
Wear new blue clothes, fast, and contemplate in silence.
Bhiká¹£us are also like this.
They can only eat sesame, curd, milk, rice gruel, rice, and vegetables.
After defecating or urinating, one must bathe.
When ascending the high seat, first pay homage to all Buddhas in the ten directions.
Burn incense, scatter flowers, and invite all Buddhas and great Bodhisattvas in the ten directions,
As well as all heavenly dragon kings,
For the sake of sentient beings, always give rise to a compassionate mind and do not harbor evil thoughts.
With this homage to the Buddha and all merits and virtues,
Dedicate them to all heavenly dragon kings,
As well as all sentient beings with form and life.
When ascending the Dharma seat, read the sÅ«tras with a loud voice day and night without interruption.
For one seven-day period, two seven-day periods,
Or up to three seven-day periods, it will definitely bring down sweet rain.
The Buddha told the dragon kings,
The tides of the ocean still have waxing and waning.
These words are true and will definitely not be false.
At that time, the dragon kings, having received the Buddha's teachings,
Rejoiced and respectfully carried out the instructions.
